text.p: Tropical Cyclone Justin will continue to cause problems for shipping and boating in the Coral Sea. Top winds are about 50 mph near the center of this system. It is located about 535 miles east-northeast of Cairns Australia and is nearly stationary. A southward drift is expected later in the weekend. Shipping and boating in the Coral sea will be affected by winds and also rough seas.

Tropical cyclone 33p with 40 mph winds is well north of the Fiji islands at this time and moving eastward. It is expected to turn towards the south during the next 12-24 hours. It should cross the Fiji islands with top winds of 50-55 mph in about 48 hours. TC33p will become an increasing risk to shipping during this weekend. It will also bring rain and potential flooding to the islands during this period.
There are no further emergency statements at this time.
